question_text: Why might a user be unable to install a 2.5 inch SATA SSD in a modern ultrathin laptop?
answer_options: Ultrathin laptops lack a SATA data interface
The battery physically blocks all storage bays
2.5 inch drives are only supported in desktops
correct_answer: Ultrathin laptops lack a SATA data interface
explanation: Ultrathin laptops often lack traditional SATA connectors and bays, using M.2 instead.
